item.title: 在谈判取得突破之际，LIV 高尔夫球手将赢得更多大满贯赛参赛席位
item.description: LIV Golf 正在为其明星球手争取更多参加世界顶级赛事的名额，为这个由沙特支持的独立联盟与美国和欧洲巡回赛的统一铺平道路。【原文：LIV Golf is closing in on more places for its star golfers at the world’s premier competitions, paving the way for unification between the breakaway Saudi-backed league and the US and European tours.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德的财富部门目标从私人现金中获取 1000 亿美元
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）首席执行官约翰-斯威尼（John Sweeney）表示，该公司的私人财富部门希望在未来五年内资产规模达到 1000 亿美元。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management’s private wealth arm aspires to reach $100 billion in assets in the next five years, its chief executive John Sweeney said.】

item.title: 印度加大刺激力度以刺激疲软经济
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）指望通过减税和降息双管齐下的刺激措施来扭转印度经济放缓的局面，但投资者可能需要更多的说服力来证明这些措施是足够的。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi is counting on a two-pronged stimulus of tax and interest rate cuts to turn around India’s slowing economy, but investors may need more convincing that the measures will be enough.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁征收的关税远不足以为减税买单
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普上周末威胁要对加拿大、墨西哥和中国征收关税，金融市场为之哗然，但据经济学家估计，这些关税远不足以抵消美国延长其即将到期的2017年减税政策所需的成本。【原文：The tariffs President Donald Trump threatened against Canada, Mexico and China over the weekend roiled financial markets but they fall far short of duties the US would need to offset the cost of extending his expiring 2017 tax cuts, economists estimate.】

item.title: 以下是美国 1 月份就业报告的主要内容
item.description: 以下是周五公布的美国 1 月份就业报告的主要内容：【原文：Here are the key takeaways from the US employment report for January released Friday:】

item.title: 可可价格接近历史最高纪录正在摧毁巧克力需求
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Rising chocolate prices will hurt demand this year, resulting in a smaller than anticipated supply shortfall, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 德意志银行在欧洲央行调查中提高 SRT 杠杆率标准
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）正在收紧为对冲基金等投资者提供贷款以购买重大风险转移产品的条件。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG is tightening terms under which it provides loans for investors such as hedge funds to buy significant risk transfers.】

item.title: 特斯拉在欧盟顶级电动汽车市场上落后于大众和西雅特
item.description: 特斯拉公司是上个月德国电动汽车制造商中的最大输家，德国消费者对埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的品牌嗤之以鼻，购买了更多的大众（Volkswagen）、西亚特（Seat）和宝马（BMW）汽车。【原文：Tesla Inc. was the biggest loser among electric-vehicle makers last month in Germany, where consumers snubbed Elon Musk’s brand and bought more Volkswagen, Seat and BMW cars.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利称 2025 年利率将 "小幅 "下降
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，美国劳动力市场有所降温，但仍保持稳健，2025 年的利率可能会 "适度 "下降。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said the US labor market had cooled but remained solid, and interest rates are likely to decline “modestly” in 2025.】

item.title: 津巴布韦开始为其没收的农场付款以履行赔偿协议
item.description: 津巴布韦已开始向其土地在 2000 年代被没收的国家和农民支付赔偿金，这是向重组其 210 亿美元债务迈出的一步。【原文：Zimbabwe has started paying reparations to nations and farmers whose land was seized in the 2000s, a step toward the restructuring of its $21 billion debt pile.】

item.title: 英格兰银行首席经济学家称部分同事 "急于 "降息
item.description: 英格兰银行首席经济学家休-皮尔（Huw Pill）反驳了投票支持大幅降息的同事们，认为他们 "急于 "过快地改变政策。【原文：Bank of England Chief Economist Huw Pill pushed back against colleagues voting for a large interest rate cut, arguing that they are “rushing” to change policy too quickly.】

item.title: 欧盟考虑暂停对叙利亚石油业和银行的制裁
item.description: 欧盟正在讨论一项协议，以部分暂停对叙利亚能源行业的几项制裁，包括取消从该国进口原油和向石油天然气行业出口技术的禁令。【原文：The European Union is discussing a deal to partially suspend several sanctions on Syria’s energy industry, including scrapping bans on importing crude from the country and on exporting technologies to the oil and gas industry.】

item.title: 津巴布韦斥资 4 亿美元支持 ZiG 首次亮相不到一年
item.description: 津巴布韦中央银行表示，自 4 月份推出新的黄金支持货币以来的 10 个月里，该行已花费 4 亿多美元支持这种货币。【原文：Zimbabwe’s central bank said it has spent more than $400 million supporting the country’s new gold-backed currency in the 10 months since its April launch.】

item.title: 亿万富翁支持的 P1 风险投资公司押注非洲尚未开发的市场
item.description: 一家由埃及亿万富翁穆罕默德-曼苏尔（Mohamed Mansour）和世界银行私人投资部门支持的风险投资公司在完成其首笔 5000 万美元的机构基金后，将在非洲新兴中心寻找技术机会。【原文：A venture capital firm backed by Egyptian billionaire Mohamed Mansour and the World Bank’s private investment arm will seek out tech opportunities in emerging African hubs after closing its first $50 million institutional fund.】

item.title: 奥特曼说他 "喜欢 "欧洲星际之门，并警告人工智能规则的影响
item.description: OpenAI 首席执行官萨姆-阿尔特曼（Sam Altman）表示，他 "非常愿意 "帮助建造欧洲星际之门，不过欧洲大陆的法规将决定这项技术的发展速度。【原文：OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman said he’d “love” to help build a European Stargate, though the continent’s regulations will determine how quickly the technology advances.】

item.title: 就业报告维持美联储路径不变，国债跌幅扩大
item.description: 美国政府债券下跌，原因是好坏参半的就业数据让交易员们对美联储将在今年晚些时候之前保持利率稳定的预期持谨慎态度。【原文：US government bonds fell as mixed employment data left traders holding tight to expectations that the Federal Reserve will keep interest rates steady until later this year.】

item.title: 莫迪将在下周与特朗普的会谈中优先考虑贸易问题
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）下周与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）会晤时，将试图解决与双边贸易有关的问题，并寻求美国对印度民用核能的投资。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attempt to iron out issues related to bilateral trade and seek US investments in India’s civil nuclear energy when he meets President Donald Trump next week.】

item.title: 2024 年下调后美国 1 月份新增就业岗位 14.3 万个
item.description: 美国政府的年度修正报告显示，去年劳动力市场的活力低于此前的预期，因此美国 1 月份的就业增长有所放缓。【原文：US job growth moderated in January after annual revisions from the government revealed less vigor in the labor market last year than previously thought.】

item.title: 加拿大新增就业岗位 7.6 万个，失业率降至 6.6
item.description: 尽管年初关税大战迫在眉睫，但加拿大企业似乎仍在疯狂招聘。【原文：Canadian businesses appeared to be on a hiring spree even as a tariff war loomed large at the start of the year.】

item.title: 印度家庭认为未来一年通胀率将逐步上升
item.description: 印度家庭预计，在食品和住房成本上升的带动下，通胀率将在三个月到一年内逐步上升。【原文：Indian households expect inflation to inch up through three months to a year from now, led by costlier food and housing.】

item.title: 埃利奥特成为阿斯彭科技投资者，反对艾默生的条款
item.description: 知情人士透露，艾略特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）已成为工业软件公司 Aspen Technology Inc.【原文：Elliott Investment Management has emerged as the largest minority investor in industrial-software company Aspen Technology Inc., with a position worth more than $1.5 billion, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 俄罗斯导弹袭击迫使乌克兰向欧盟购买天然气
item.description: 据知情人士透露，俄罗斯导弹对乌克兰国有天然气资产的袭击迫使该国从欧盟购买昂贵的替代燃料。【原文：Russian missile attacks on state-owned natural gas assets in Ukraine have forced the country to buy expensive replacement fuel from the European Union, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: AMD 股价暴跌表明人工智能没有银奖
item.description: 在制造用于训练人工智能软件的芯片方面，Advanced Micro Devices 公司被认为是 Nvidia 公司最大的竞争对手。【原文：Regarded as the biggest competitor to Nvidia Corp. in making chips used to train artificial intelligence software, Advanced Micro Devices Inc.’s shares look less like an immediate rival.】

item.title: 武伊契奇认为欧洲央行春季降息更加明朗，降息押注合理
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员鲍里斯-武伊契奇（Boris Vujcic）表示，尽管要等到第二季度开始才能更确定地知道欧洲央行今年是否会降息，但目前市场对欧洲央行今年再降息三次的预期是合理的。【原文：Market expectations for three more European Central Bank interest-rate cuts this year are reasonable right now, even though it will take until the start of the second quarter to know with more certainty if they’ll materialize, according to Governing Council member Boris Vujcic.】

item.description: 几十年来，伊朗一直因其核野心以及是否正在发展发射原子武器的能力而备受怀疑。【原文：Iran has faced suspicion for decades over its nuclear ambitions and whether it’s developing the capability to fire an atomic weapon.】

item.title: 降息后墨西哥通胀放缓幅度超出预期
item.description: 墨西哥 1 月份的通胀放缓幅度超过预期，支持了墨西哥央行将基准利率下调半个百分点的决定，并发出了进一步下调相同幅度利率的信号。【原文：Mexico’s inflation slowed more than expected in January, supporting the central bank’s decision to deliver a half-point cut to its benchmark interest rate and signal additional reductions of the same magnitude.】

item.title: DeepSeek 的启示对投资者比对科技公司首席执行官更可怕
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，伊恩-金（Ian King）撰文指出，投资者似乎更关心 DeepSeek 的人工智能突破所带来的影响，而不是那些可能因变革而被颠覆的美国科技公司的领导者。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ian King writes that investors seem more concerned about the effects of DeepSeek’s AI breakthrough than the leaders of the US tech companies that might be upended by changes.】
